column3: I added a  -seednode= option, which causes a short-lived connection to the specified address (which may be a name, and can be passed directly to the proxy, without leaking DNS information) until some peer addresses are returned, and disconnects. This mechanism is used implicitly instead of DNS seeding when -proxydns is enabled.\n\nThe functionality itself doesn't really fit in this pull request, s

Is it possible to specify different proxies for different address types, and possibly to even round-robin proxies/non-proxies for certain address types? e.g. for .onion addresses, always use 127.0.0.1:9050, for .i2p, always use 127.0.0.1:4444, and for ipv4 and ipv6 round-robin between 127.0.0.1:9050 and no-proxy.\n\nI've patched by bitcoin to introduce a -proxytoo option, which allows me to 50% ra
If Pieter Wuille's code fails, he didn't write bad code. The compiler compiled it wrong.
This is on by default, should probably say so in the description\n
If it's not supposed to be true by default, why set proxydns to true here?\n
ok, good. Sucks that github shows so little context around diffs\n
